definition: to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: Does water exert the same pressure in all directions?
sentences.chinese: 水向各個方向所施加的壓力相同嗎？

sentences.english: Do not misconstrue it as an effort to exert force or pressure.
sentences.chinese: 不要把它誤解爲需要卯盡全力或施加壓力的苦差事。

sentences.english: In this study, various coupling agents were also used to improve strength of particleboard.
sentences.chinese: 施加偶聯劑也可以提高玻璃纖維布增強刨花板的強度。

sentences.english: The green budget measure turns the pressure back on his critics.
sentences.chinese: 這些綠色預算措施將壓力施加給陸先生的批評家們。

sentences.english: They also said they would pressure some members who have been overproducing.
sentences.chinese: 他們還表示要向超產的一些成員國施加壓力。

sentences.english: We now have more public opinion exerting pressure on politics than ever before.
sentences.chinese: 現在對政治施加壓力的公衆輿論比以前增多了。

sentences.english: Pressure on the underside of the thighs from an incorrect (too high) seat position makes this worse.
sentences.chinese: 對大腿下面施加壓力的不正確坐姿會使情況更糟。

sentences.english: Pre-stress must be inflicted during the cable net construction.
sentences.chinese: 索網在建設時必須施加預應力。

sentences.english: It also seeks to influence the decisions being made in Tehran.
sentences.chinese: 同時也是在試圖對德黑蘭的決定施加影響。

sentences.english: It was reported that a certain statesman had exercised great political influence over you.
sentences.chinese: 據傳某政治家曾對你施加過巨大的政治影響。

sentences.english: The factories have pressurized the farmers into producing more milk.
sentences.chinese: 工廠對農民施加壓力，要他們生產更多的牛奶。

sentences.english: The Pureland Wheel mantra sheet can be offered on the altar or burned to grant blessings.
sentences.chinese: 此淨土咒輪可以供在佛桌上或焚化以施加持。

sentences.english: He tells us how to cross the barriers that we impose on our lives.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴我們如何跨越我們自己施加於生命的障礙。

sentences.english: The elastic nature of the condom also adds pressure to the mix.
sentences.chinese: 套套的彈性還可以在這些碎布上施加壓力。

sentences.english: Compliances is the deflection resulting from the application of force.
sentences.chinese: 彈性運動性是對因外力的施加產生撓曲運動的研究。
不要施加壓力，不要受制於人。

definition: to fire/to discharge/to release (fireworks, smokescreen, poison gas, virus etc)
buffer/to cushion/to adjust to sharp changes
to release/to set free/to liberate (a prisoner)/to discharge
to remove/to sack/to get rid of/to relieve (sb of their duties)/to free/to lift (an embargo)/to rescind (an agreement)
